data.title: Where is Virgin River filmed? Guide to ALL the Locations - The House & the Bar
data.meta_description: Complete Guide to all the Filming Locations of Virgin River - the Third Season set in California - Jack's Bar and Melinda's real house
data.text:
Posted by Ra Moon

Now back for the fifth season, Virgin River was filmed in and around Vancouver in British Columbia. The story follows nurse practitioner Melinda Munroe who decides to make a fresh start after becoming a widow.

Melinda moves to the remote (and fictional) Californian town of Virgin River, located in the redwood forests of Humboldt County, where the series is set. Melinda meets an intriguing man, Jack Sheridan, who is a former Marine, and owner of Jack’s Bar.

Created by Sue Tenney, the show stars Alexandra Breckenridge (This Is Us, American Horror Story) as Melinda, while Martin Henderson (Grey’s Anatomy) plays Jack.

Netflix's Virgin River is an adaptation based on Robyn Carr's bestselling 20-book series of the same name.

Welcome to the best and most complete guide to all the filming locations of Virgin River. You'll find the locations in order of appearance, with the new season 5 updates below in the report.

Welcome to Virgin River, California

In the first season, some exteriors of the fictional village were recorded in Bowen Island.

The film crew took footage of the streets and buildings in the charming harbor town of Snug Cove, as reported by the local news source Bowen Island Undercurrent.

Note the American flag waving in front of the Canadian town public library. The neighborhood around Artisan Lane is full of cute and colorful houses.

(You can open all the locations on Google Maps by clicking on the links below in the captions ↴)

Image courtesy of Netflix and Google Maps

The Virgin River House

Our sleuthing revealed that the magnificent Vernon Mullins' Family Practice Clinic house is located at 122 First Street in New Westminster.

This Victorian home, built in 1889, is situated in the historic Queen’s Park neighborhood. According to this property's listing service, the house is nicknamed Breezehurst.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The mansion is a spectacular Queen Anne-style home featuring more than 6,000 square feet of living space over four floors, a lovely wrap-around veranda, mature gardens, and the beautiful stained glass windows that we can appreciate in the series.

However, Doc's house interiors are a set built at the studios.

Mel's cabin is the caretaker’s house in Murdo Frazer Park on Vancouver's North Shore, near the Pitch and Putt Public golf course.

Since it was built in 1950, the cabin has often appeared in movies and TV shows including The Flash, The Magicians, Once Upon a Time, or Siren.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

After fixing it, the log cabin looks this good. The area where the house is located in North Vancouver is fairly dense residential, with lots of developments around.

However, it seems rural because the house is on a park with five acres of land with wooded trails and a small pond.

The exteriors of Jack's bar were filmed at The Watershed Grill near the Eagle Run Viewing Shelter in Brackendale (Squamish).

This is a fantastic place with awesome views over the Brackendale Eagles Provincial Park and its surrounding mountains. Several scenes with Mel and Jack were also filmed here at the Squamish River.

However, the interior of the bar was recorded at the studios in Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The 'Welcome to Virgin River' sign from the first episode was filmed on Pioneer Avenue in Agassiz.

This is a small town in British Columbia, about 60 miles east of Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix and Google Maps

Hope McCrea's house (the mayor of Virgin River) is the Edgar Residence at 6450 Deer Lake Drive in Burnaby.

This beautiful wood-frame bungalow, built in 1912, is registered as a historic heritage building.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The footage of the waterfall was taken at Shannon Falls Provincial Park.

The fall is located very close to Squamish along the scenic Sea to Sky Highway.

Image courtesy of Brook Peterson - Map

The Fitches Bed and Breakfast is the Klahanie Campground situated across from Shannon Falls.

Notice the small tower added digitally on the top of the house.

Image courtesy of Netflix and Google Maps

Filming also took place in the Deer Lake Park and Foreshore Park in Burnaby, where the scenes featuring Paige’s Bakeaway food truck were set.

The Virgin River Community Picnic from the fourth episode of season two was also filmed here, near Deer Lake Avenue.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

These two minor locations are very close to each other in Port Coquitlam. The bar where Mel and Jack go in episode 7 is Samz Neighbourhood Pub at 2342 Elgin Avenue.

Charmaine Roberts’ hairdressing saloon (lower pictures) is the In a Wink Beautique at 2627 Shaughnessy Strret.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Maps: Pub - Store

The Eureka harbor from episode 9 is Steveston Harbor in Richmond. Pictured, a scene with Pajo's Fish and Chips in the background.

Arthur’s restaurant, where Melinda and Jack have a romantic dinner, is located next door, and in real life is known as The Crab King (exteriors only).

The Apple TV+ series Home Before Dark set in Erie Harbor, Washington, was also filmed here.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

New Season 2 Locations

First seen in the second season, the farmhouse is another recurring location throughout the series.

This lovely location, which has been featured in many other shows and movies including The X-Files and The 100, is the Blieberger Farm in Langley.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The picnic area with Page's Bakewaway food truck is the Cleveland Dam at the head of the Capilano River in North Vancouver, with picturesque vistas to the mountains.

Grayson Gurnsey plays Ricky and Canadian actress Sarah Dugdale is Lizzie, Connie's niece from Los Angeles.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The bank is the Chances Casino in Squamish, located under the dramatic cliffs of the Apron mountain in the Stawamus Chief Provincial Park.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

Also in the first episode of the second season, "New Beginnings", Mel is running across the jaw-dropping Lynn Valley Suspension Bridge in North Vancouver.

This hanging bridge was also featured in a scene with Lizzie and Denny Cutler (Kai Bradbury) from the fourth episode of season four.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

In the same episode, Preacher (Colin Lawrence) and Paige (Lexa Doig) have a walk very close from there, in the forested trails and wooden bridges of the Capilano River Regional Park.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

Mel and Doc have coffee in The Lynn Canyon Cafe lodge in North Vancouver.

Also, in the third episode of the fourth season, "Grilled", Page's Bakewaway food truck is parked next to the lodge.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The Connies General Store that appears for the first time in episode three, "The Morning After", is the Cypress Park Market located at 4360 Marine Drive in West Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The restaurant from episode 7, "Breaking Point", is the Eagle Harbour Yacht Club, also in West Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

Season 3 Filming Locations

The fictional Camp Pinehurst from the first episode, "Where There's Smoke...", is the Deer Lake in Burnaby.

Surrounded by many scenic walking trails and wildlife, you'll find Burnaby's cultural centre to the north of Deer Lake.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

In the second episode, "Sticky Feet", Mel meets Brie, Jack's sister (played by Zibby Allen) in Marine Drive in Dundarave (West Vancouver).

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The bar where Brie and Dan Brady (played by Benjamin Hollingsworth) hang out is The Red Lion Bar and Grill, a real pub located at 2427 Marine Drive, also in West Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

In episode six, "Jack and Jill", the Lumberjack Games take place at the fictional Shelter Mountain Ski Resort.

This episode was recorded on top of Grouse Mountain in North Vancouver. This alpine ski area, situated at about 4,100 feet (1,200 m), overlooks Metro Vancouver.

The Lumberjack Games is an axe-throwing, tree-climbing, and log-rolling show set in two logging camps from the early 1900s that you can visit in summer.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The dock was filmed at Whonnock Lake in Maple Ridge.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The church from episode nine, "The Sun Also Rises", is St. Francis-in-the-Wood, an Anglican temple located in a nice setting near the ocean in Cypress Park (West Vancouver).

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The waterfall that appears in a couple of establishing shots during the third season is the stunning 230-feet (70-meter) Brandywine Falls, located along the famous Sea To Sky Highway between Squamish and Whistler.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

Season 4

Jack's dream in the first episode of the season, "Be My Baby", was filmed at VanDusen Botanical Garden, located on the grounds of a former golf course in the Shaughnessy neighborhood of Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The scene with Jack and Mel in a busy street of Virgin River was filmed on Marine Drive in West Vancouver.

As in the third season, there are several scenes filmed here, between 24th and 25th Streets, including a short one with Vernon Mullins outside the Hair Villa Beauty salon.

The bar where Mel and Joey Barnes (Jenny Cooper) have a drink in episode seven, "Otherwise Engaged", is the Temper Chocolate and Pastry (pictured) at 2409 Marine Drive.

The clothing store of the eighth episode, "Talk to Me", is the Ami Boutique at 2463 Marine Drive.

The City Hospital of Eureka from the second episode, "Father Knows Best...?", was filmed in one of the buildings of the former old Riverview Mental Hospital in Coquitlam.

This is a very popular filming location in Vancouver, which has been rented out many times to film all kind of productions.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

In the third episode, "Grilled", there's an establishing shot of the Tower Bridge in Sacramento, California.

This yellow vertical lift bridge was built in 1935.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The blue farmers market where Preacher and Julia run into each other is Krause Berry Farms and Estate Winery in Langley.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The fictional Swinton's Food Market was filmed at the Greystone Super Valu, a former Grocery store at 601 Burnwood Drive in Burnaby.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

In the fourth episode, "Serious As A..." Brie and Brady meet at the BjornBar Bakery in Edgemont Village, North Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The Renaissance Faire in the sixth episode, "All's Faire..." was filmed at Princess Park in North Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

In the ninth episode, "Bombshells", Mel gets a call from Stacie (Mark's sister), who is walking outside the Choices Markets at 1888 W 57th Avenue W in Vancouver.

Later on, they meet for dinner in the Secret Garden Tea Company at 2138 W 40th Avenue in West Side, Vancouver (pictured).

Image courtesy of Netflix - Maps: Choices Markets / Secret Garden

The romantic dock in episode eleven, "Once Again", is the Great Yogi Pier in Port Moody.

The dinner scene in the season finale, "The Long Goodbye", was recorded in The Boathouse Restaurant, located across from the pier.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The Hollywood Theatre with neon signs is a restored 1935 Art Deco theater at 3123 West Broadway in Vancouver.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The New Season 5 Locations

In the first episode of season five, "A Second Chance", there is a scene where Mel is on the Sky Pilot Suspension Bridge near Squamish.

The mountain range in the background is the 2,000-meter (about 6,560 feet) Sky Pilot Mountain.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The interior of the courthouse building was filmed at the Anvil Centre, a cultural hub in the heart of New Westminster.

The exterior in the fifth episode is some stock footage of an office building located at 15101 Alton Parkway in Irvine, California.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The Virgin River Players is the small and cozy Bernie Legge Theatre in New Westminster.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

In the second episode, "Songbird", Mel and Jack are at a viewpoint overlooking the Howe Sound near the Sea to Sky Gondola Summit Lodge.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The Emerald Lumber Company is located under Stawamus Chief Mountain, on the Mamquam Blind Channel in Squamish.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The spa in the fourth episode, "Never Gonna Be the Same", is the Camp Howdy in Belcarra, located just 40 minutes from downtown Vancouver.

Nestled within lush evergreen forests along the shores of the Indian Arm, Camp Howdy offers a picturesque backdrop for corporate retreats and weddings.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The Darrell Bay Ferry Terminal in Squamish is featured in several scenes throughout the season.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

The Labor Day Carnival in the season finale was filmed on the shore of the Upper Pond in Burnaby's Central Park.

Image courtesy of Netflix - Map

Can you help to improve this article about the filming locations of Virgin River? To complete and correct this report, any feedback, info, or images that you may have are more than welcome, thank you!

NOTICE: If you’re using this information on your website, please credit and link to this page as a source.

*****

Glad to hear another season is coming... bring it on!

I guess it is on maybe five acres tho, so seems rural. I am happy to see it in this show as well as the other locations that I know quite well (Squamish area).

Fictional towns in BC would suffice. Just sayin' And yes, most don't care, until your town is in a series and it's Not!

55- Lilly - Jul 22, 2022, 6:29 PM

56- John Australia - Jul 27, 2022, 10:55 PM

57- Anonymous - Jul 29, 2022, 5:31 AM

Hello, I would like to know where is the bar where Nate and Jack take a glass in episode 408.

58- Betty - Jul 31, 2022, 4:20 AM

Roll on series 5!

59- Anonymous - Jul 31, 2022, 8:53 PM

The reason it is filmed in BC Canada, the greater Vancouver area, close to the Washington USA border, and not in northern Cali is because there are big film grants and tax breaks for filming here. And there are existing studios and a large population of film crew here.

We are known as Hollywood north. And at any time, you can walk down the street and either see a celeb or run into the filming of some sort. Last week I ran into four different productions going on within 25 miles. It is very affordable to film here in the greater Vancouver area, the temperature is always mild and tons of film crews are here to hire.

Sadly though, often our local actors are not up to LA par, but generally, main stars in larger productions are brought up from LA or New York, thankfully. You can tell the difference. As with Jack here. Far superior acting ability and experience to all other actors in this production. Not a dis, just the facts of our filming system here. Our studios are second to none as well.

60- Anonymous - Aug 13, 2022, 6:35 AM

I just love everything about Virgin River - I’ve watched all series four times, it’s my happy place.

61- Mike - Aug 24, 2022, 12:38 AM

The old cabin on the pond that Mel stays in the first night (I've just started watching today), is the same cabin Anne Heche's character lived in, in Men in Trees.

62- Anonymous - Oct 4, 2022, 8:25 PM

As a resident of Humboldt and Del Note counties from 1970 to 1995, it is so cool that all these towns are mentioned in the Virgin River TV series!

Atlas of Wonders is looking for wonderful Filming Locations all around the world. We are constantly updating and improving our posts with new details and images. Follow us here:
